842 R
Adaina cinerascens (Walsingham, 1880) Jun M
– – T: McDunnough (1939a)
L: Bowman (1951) C: CNC

Small ( 14–25 mm wingspan) cryptically colored moths with moderately broad, round- ed wings. Th ere are no readily distinguishable features, and no clear autapomorphies separate them from the Carposinidae . Larvae are borers or concealed feeders.

Approximately 40 species of Copromorphidae are known worldwide, primarily in the tropics. Five species are known from North America; one of these occurs AB. The North American fauna was treated by Heppner (1984 , 1986 ).
